project.teaser: NGI0 Review is a unique technical review and support hub for the Next Generation Internet initiative. Open source projects funded by NGI can apply for concrete technical assessments, audits and scans by experts in an open, collaborative environment. NGI0 Review levers the...
project.objective: NGI0 Review is a unique technical review and support hub for the Next Generation Internet initiative. Open source projects funded by NGI can apply for concrete technical assessments, audits and scans by experts in an open, collaborative environment. NGI0 Review levers the proven successful NGI Zero 'greenhouse environment' where selected open source projects are supported by world class domain experts in various fields such as security, accessibility, license compliance, standardization, internationalisation, etcetera. The experts participating in NGI0 Review provide reviews, guidance and mentoring so selected NGI projects can meet important requirements and needs of internet scale. Using a hybrid model of paid professional services and volunteer activity, the open collaborative environment allows anyone to contribute, including our extensive network of open source developers, data scientists, cybersecurity experts, standards experts, user interface designers and many more. Organized outreach and ecosystem engagement through ICT inclusivity experts like the Association for Progressive Communication and the oldest European internet charity NLnet foundation will disseminate the output of NGI0 Review to civil society, human rights and consumer organisations as well as mainstream media and educational environments. Finally, technology of selected projects can become part of the largest open source software collection currently available through the Nix community which packages software to be reproducible, reliable and verifiable.
project.title: NGI0 Review
project.keywords: technical assessment, review, open source software

result.title: Communication plan
result.description: Plan to organize and do communication for the purpose of ecosystem building, where we reach out to and engage with among others civil society and digital rights organizations, education and other public sector actors, the technical, operational and internet governance communities and connect with other Horizon Europe-projects and the NGI-innovator ecosystem.

result.title: Data management plan
result.description: This plan will detail how we intend to collect, organize and publish data from the accepted projects and research output.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - NGI0 Review (NGI0 Review)
result.teaser: NGI0 Review is a support service oriented programme within the Next Generation Internet (NGI) initiative to support projects that are part of ongoing or previous NGI programmes. It is aimed to support these projects with services that are of importance to deliver secure...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Summer of Nix 2023 report
result.description: NGI Zero and the Nix community will organise three editions of the Summer of Nix in addition to the ongoing process of packaging funded projects in a declarative, transparent and verifiable way. This deliverable will provide a report on the second edition in 2023.

result.title: Initial collection of ontology
result.description: The start of NGI Zero support services is usually a review of the initial situation. These yields information about the projects. We’ll collect this information as Linked Data. An ontology will grow from this effort. The ontology will enabled digital signing and federated publication of information.

result.title: List of accepted projects III
result.description: Structured information on projects accepted through applications for support on the open collaboration environment.

result.title: Open collaboration environment
result.description: Open collaboration environment (web portal) with access to all services and knowledge created in NGI0 Review and communication channels with developers and NGI0 Review experts.

result.title: Student assignment portal
result.description: We provide in-depth accessibility audits and guidance. The HAN lectureship Inclusive Design & Engineering will involve students and researchers to review the accessibility of projects, organised as tasks in an online portal provisioned by HAN and NLnet.

result.title: Summer of Nix 2022 report
result.description: NGI Zero and the Nix community will organise three editions of the Summer of Nix in addition to the ongoing process of packaging funded projects in a declarative, transparent and verifiable way. This deliverable will provide a report on the first edition in 2022.

result.title: List of accepted projects II
result.description: Structured information on projects accepted through applications for support on the open collaboration environment.

result.title: Initial collection of structured project information
result.description: The start of NGI Zero support services is usually a review of the initial situation. These yields information about the projects. We’ll collect this information as Linked Data. An ontology will grow from this effort. The ontology will enabled digital signing and federated publication of information. This deliverable will provide all structured information from the accepted projects using this ontology in a reusable way.

result.title: List of accepted projects
result.description: Structured information on projects accepted through applications for support on the open collaboration environment.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
